definitions.definition: A word-for-word report of a speech.
(of a document) Corresponding with the original word for word.
definitions.example: Date unknown: Joint Committee on Printing Congress of the United States, General Statement of Procedure for Verbatim Reporting of Proceedings in Senate Chamber, page five:

definitions.definition: (of a person) Able to take down a speech word for word, especially in shorthand.
Word for word; in exactly the same words as were used originally.
definitions.example: I have copied his speech verbatim, so this is exactly what he said, word for word.
